sen.j: 西大寺（さいだいじ）は、奈良県奈良市西大寺芝町にある、真言律宗総本山の寺院。
sen.e: Saidai-ji Temple is a temple which is located in Saidaiji Shibamachi, Nara City, Nara Prefecture and the grand head temple of Shingon Risshu sect..
Saidai-ji Temple is a temple which is located in Saidaiji Shibamachi, Nara City, Nara Prefecture and the grand head temple of Shingon Risshu sect.
Saidai-ji Temple is a temple which is located in Saidaiji Shibamachi, Nara City, Nara Prefecture and the grand head temple of Shingon Risshu sect.

sen.j: 奈良時代に孝謙天皇の発願により、僧・常騰（じょうとう）を開山（初代住職）として建立された。
sen.e: It was built in Nara Period at the wish of the Emperor Koken having Joto, a priest, as kaisan (the first chief priest).
It was built in the Nara period at the wish of the Empress Koken having Joto, a priest, as kaisan (the first chief priest).
sen.cmt: in the Nara periodとし、余分なスペース消去、「孝謙天皇」→女性天皇のため、Empress Kokenとしました。
sen.e: It was built in the Nara period at the wish of the Empress Koken having Joto, a priest, as kaisan (the first chief priest).

sen.j: 南都七大寺の1つとして奈良時代には壮大な伽藍を誇ったが、平安時代に一時衰退した。
sen.e: As one of seven large temples of Nanto (Nara), it boasted magnificent temple buildings in Nara Period, but it declined in Heian Period for certain time period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As one of the Seven Great Temples of Nanto (Nara), it boasted magnificent temple buildings in the Nara period, but it declined in the Heian period for a certain time.
sen.cmt: the Seven Great Temples of Nanto、in the Nara period、in the Heian period、for a certain timeとしました。
sen.e: As one of the Seven Great Temples of Nanto (Nara), it boasted magnificent temple buildings in the Nara period, but it declined in the Heian period for a certain time.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代に興正菩薩叡尊（こうしょうぼさつえいそん）によって復興された。
sen.e: It was restored in Kamakura Period by Koshobosatsu Eison.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was restored in the Kamakura period by Koshobosatsu Eison.
sen.cmt: in the Kamakura periodとしました。
sen.e: It was restored in the Kamakura period by Koshobosatsu Eison.

sen.j: 山号を勝宝山と称する（ただし、奈良時代の寺院には山号はなく、後になって付けられたものである）。
sen.e: Its sango (the name of a group of Buddhist temples to which the temple belongs) is Shohozan (In Nara Period, temple had not sango and its sango was given later.).
Its sango (the name of a group of Buddhist temples to which the temple belongs) is Shohozan (In the Nara period, temples did not have sango and its sango was given later.).
sen.cmt: In the Nara periodとし、temple had not sango→temples did not have sangoに修正
sen.e: Its sango (the name of a group of Buddhist temples to which the temple belongs) is Shohozan (In the Nara period, temples did not have sango and its sango was given later.).

sen.j: 現在の本尊は釈迦如来である。
sen.e: Present honzon (principal object of worship) is Shakanyorai (Shakyamuni).
Present honzon (principal object of worship) is Shakanyorai (Shakyamuni).
Present honzon (principal object of worship) is Shakanyorai (Shakyamuni).

sen.j: 西大寺は、天平神護元年（765年）に称徳天皇の勅願により創建された寺院である。
sen.e: Saidai-ji Temple is a temple which was established in 765 at the imperial order of the Emperor Shotoku.
Saidai-ji Temple is a temple which was established in 765 at the imperial order of the Empress Shotoku (Empress Koken).
sen.cmt: 女性天皇のためEmpress Shotokuとし、前出のEmpress Kokenと同一人物であるためカッコ表記にて追加
sen.e: Saidai-ji Temple is a temple which was established in 765 at the imperial order of the Empress Shotoku (Empress Koken).

sen.j: 藤原仲麻呂の乱平定を祈願して孝謙上皇（称徳天皇）が造立した金銅四天王像を安置している。
sen.e: Gilt copper Shitenno-zo (Image of the four guardian kings) which were built by Retired Emperor Koken (Emperor Shotoku) invoking suppression of rebellion by Fujiwara no Nakamaro have been enshrined..
sen.cmt: 「金銅」と表記された場合に、その本体が「gilt copper」であるか、「gilt bronze」であるか確認できないため、「gilt copper」で統一しました。以下同様です。
sen.e: Gilt copper statues of Shitenno (the four guardian kings) which were built by the Retired Empress Koken (Empress Shotoku) invoking suppression of rebellion by FUJIWARA no Nakamaro have been enshrined.
sen.cmt: Shitenno-zo (Image of the four guardian kings)→statues of Shitenno (the four guardian kings)、the Retired Empress Koken (Empress Shotoku)とし、Fujiwara no Nakamaro→FUJIWARA no Nakamaroに修正、余分なピリオド削除
sen.e: Gilt copper statues of Shitenno (the four guardian kings) which were built by the Retired Empress Koken (Empress Shotoku) invoking suppression of rebellion by FUJIWARA no Nakamaro have been enshrined.

sen.j: この四天王像は西大寺四王堂に今も安置されるが、増長天像が足元に踏みつける邪鬼だけが創建当時のもので、その他の像、本体も後世の作、補作である。
sen.e: Those Shitenno-zo are enshrined in Shitendo (hall for shitenno) of Saidai-ji Temple even today, but only Jaki (imp) which is downtrodden by statue of Zochoten (guardian of the southern quarter) is the original since establishment and all other statues are manufactured or supplemented in the later period.

Those statues of Shitenno are enshrined in Shitendo (hall for shitenno) of Saidai-ji Temple even today, but only Jaki (imp) which is downtrodden by statue of Zochoten (guardian of the southern quarter) is the original since establishment and all other statues are manufactured or supplemented in the later period.

Those statues of Shitenno are enshrined in Shitendo (hall for shitenno) of Saidai-ji Temple even today, but only Jaki (imp) which is downtrodden by statue of Zochoten (guardian of the southern quarter) is the original since establishment and all other statues are manufactured or supplemented in the later period.

sen.j: 「西大寺」の寺名は言うまでもなく、大仏で有名な「東大寺」に対するものである。
sen.e: The name of the temple "Saidai-ji" is, needless to say, in contrast to "Todai-ji Temple"which is famous for daibutsu (large statue of Buddha).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The name of the temple 'Saidai-ji' is, needless to say, in contrast to 'Todai-ji Temple' which is famous for daibutsu (large statue of Buddha).
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、スペース追加
sen.e: The name of the temple 'Saidai-ji' is, needless to say, in contrast to 'Todai-ji Temple' which is famous for daibutsu (large statue of Buddha).

sen.j: 創建時は薬師金堂、弥勒金堂、四王堂、十一面堂、東西の五重塔などが立ち並ぶ壮大な伽藍を持ち、南都七大寺の1つに数えられる大寺院であった。
sen.e: When established, it was a large temple, which was included in seven large temples of Nanto having magnificent buildings consisting of Yakushikondo (kondo (golden hall) for Yakushi (healing Bhddha), Mirokukondo (kondo for Maitreya-bodhisattva), Shitendo (hall for shitenno), Juichimendo (hall for Juichimen Kannon (eleven-faced Kannon (Goddess of Mercy)), five-storied pagodas on the east and west and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When established, it was a large temple, which was included in the Seven Great Temples of Nanto having magnificent buildings consisting of Yakushikondo (kondo [golden hall] for Yakushi [healing Buddha]), Mirokukondo (kondo for Maitreya-bodhisattva), Shitendo (hall for shitenno), Juichimendo (hall for Juichimen Kannon [eleven-faced Kannon, Goddess of Mercy]), five-story pagodas on the east and west and so on.
sen.cmt: seven large temples of Nanto→the Seven Great Temples of Nantoとし、カッコ表記修正、Bhddha→Buddha、five-storied→five-storyとしました。
sen.e: When established, it was a large temple, which was included in the Seven Great Temples of Nanto having magnificent buildings consisting of Yakushikondo (kondo [golden hall] for Yakushi [healing Buddha]), Mirokukondo (kondo for Maitreya-bodhisattva), Shitendo (hall for shitenno), Juichimendo (hall for Juichimen Kannon [eleven-faced Kannon, Goddess of Mercy]), five-story pagodas on the east and west and so on.

sen.j: しかし、平安時代に入って衰退し、火災や台風で多くの堂塔が失われ、寺は興福寺の支配下に入っていた。
sen.e: However, it declined in Heian Period and many halls and pagodas were lost by fire or typhoon and the temple itself was controlled by Kofukuj-ji Temple.
However, it declined in the Heian period and many halls and pagodas were lost by fire or typhoon and the temple itself was controlled by Kofukuj-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: in the Heian periodとしました。
sen.e: However, it declined in the Heian period and many halls and pagodas were lost by fire or typhoon and the temple itself was controlled by Kofukuj-ji Temple.

sen.j: 西大寺の中興の祖となったのは鎌倉時代の僧・叡尊（興正菩薩、1201－1290）である。
sen.e: Eison (Koshobosatsu, 1201-1290), a priest in Kamakura Period, is the restorer of Saidai-ji Temple.
Eison (Koshobosatsu, 1201-1290), a priest in the Kamakura period, is the restorer of Saidai-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: in the Kamakura periodとしました。
sen.e: Eison (Koshobosatsu, 1201-1290), a priest in the Kamakura period, is the restorer of Saidai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 叡尊は建仁元年（1201年）、大和国添上郡（現・大和郡山市）に生まれた。
sen.e: Eison was born in 1201 in Sonokami-no-kori County, Yamato Province (present Yamatokoriyama City).
Eison was born in 1201 in Sonokami County, Yamato Province (present Yamatokoriyama City).
Eison was born in 1201 in Sonokami County, Yamato Province (present Yamatokoriyama City).

sen.j: 11歳の時から醍醐寺、高野山などで修行し、文暦2年（1235年）、35歳の時に初めて西大寺に住した。
sen.e: Since the age of twelve, he had trained himself in Daigo-ji Temple, Koyasan and soon and, in 1235 when he was thirty-five years old, he became the chief priest of Saidai-ji Temple for the first time.
Since the age of eleven, he had trained himself in Daigo-ji Temple, Koyasan and soon and, in 1235 when he was thirty-five years old, he became the chief priest of Saidai-ji Temple for the first time.
Since the age of eleven, he had trained himself in Daigo-ji Temple, Koyasan and soon and, in 1235 when he was thirty-five years old, he became the chief priest of Saidai-ji Temple for the first time.

sen.j: その後一時海龍王寺（奈良市法華寺町）に住した後、嘉禎4年（1238年）西大寺に戻り、90歳で没するまで50年以上、荒廃していた西大寺の復興に尽くした。
sen.e: Since then, after experiencing the chief priest of Kairyuo-ji Temple (Hokkeji-cho, Nara City) for a certain period, he returned to Saidai-ji Temple in 1238 and devoted himself for restoration of Saidai-ji Temple, which had been devastated, for more than 50 years until he died at the age of ninety years old.

Since then, after experiencing the chief priest of Kairyuo-ji Temple (Hokkeji-cho, Nara City) for a certain period, he returned to Saidai-ji Temple in 1238 and devoted himself for restoration of Saidai-ji Temple, which had been devastated, for more than 50 years until he died at the age of ninety years old.

Since then, after experiencing the chief priest of Kairyuo-ji Temple (Hokkeji-cho, Nara City) for a certain period, he returned to Saidai-ji Temple in 1238 and devoted himself for restoration of Saidai-ji Temple, which had been devastated, for more than 50 years until he died at the age of ninety years old.

sen.j: 叡尊は、当時の日本仏教の腐敗・堕落した状況を憂い、戒律の復興に努めた。
sen.e: Eison worried about the state of corruption and degradation of Buddhism in Japan at that time and tried to restore the precepts of Buddhism.
Eison worried about the state of corruption and degradation of Buddhism in Japan at that time and tried to restore the precepts of Buddhism.
Eison worried about the state of corruption and degradation of Buddhism in Japan at that time and tried to restore the precepts of Buddhism.

sen.j: また、貧者、病者などの救済に奔走し、今日で言う社会福祉事業にも力を尽くした。
sen.e: He devoted himself also for relieving the poor and the sick and so on and exerted himself to social welfare works in the current term.
He devoted himself also for relieving the poor and the sick and so on and exerted himself to social welfare works in the current term.
He devoted himself also for relieving the poor and the sick and so on and exerted himself to social welfare works in the current term.

sen.j: 西大寺に現存する仏像、工芸品などには本尊釈迦如来像をはじめ、叡尊の時代に制作されたものが多い。
sen.e: Many of Buddha statues and handicrafts which exist now in Saidai-ji Temple including honzon (principal object of worship at a temple), Shakanyorai-zo (the statue of Shakanyorai), were made in Eison's time.
Many of Buddha statues and handicrafts which exist now in Saidai-ji Temple including honzon, the statue of Shakanyorai, were made in Eison's time.
sen.cmt: honzon→既出のため補足削除、Shakanyorai-zo (the statue of Shakanyorai)→the statue of Shakanyoraiとしました。
sen.e: Many of Buddha statues and handicrafts which exist now in Saidai-ji Temple including honzon, the statue of Shakanyorai, were made in Eison's time.

sen.j: その後も忍性などの高僧を輩出するとともに、荒廃した諸国の国分寺の再興に尽力した。
sen.e: After that also, many priests of great sanctity and learning including Ninsho appeared one after another and efforts to resptore devastated kokubunji (provincial monasteries) in vrious provinces were made.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After that also, many priests of great sanctity and learning including Ninsho appeared one after another and efforts to restore devastated kokubunji (provincial monasteries) in various provinces were made.
sen.cmt: restore, variousのスペルミス修正
sen.e: After that also, many priests of great sanctity and learning including Ninsho appeared one after another and efforts to restore devastated kokubunji (provincial monasteries) in various provinces were made.

sen.j: 南北朝時代_(日本)の明徳2年（1391年）に出された「西大寺末寺帳」には8ヶ国、同時代のその他の史料から更に十数ヶ国の国分寺が西大寺の末寺であったと推定されている。
sen.e: Eight provinces were shown in "Saidaiji Matujicho (list of all subtemples)" made in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) in 1391, and it is inferred from other historical materials of the same period that, other than those, kokubunji in ten and several provinces were subtemples of Saidai-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Eight provinces were shown in the 'Saidaiji Matujicho' (list of all subtemples) made in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) in 1391, and it is inferred from other historical materials of the same period that, other than those, kokubunji in ten and several provinces were subtemples of Saidai-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: in the 'Saidaiji Matujicho' としました。
sen.e: Eight provinces were shown in the 'Saidaiji Matujicho' (list of all subtemples) made in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) in 1391, and it is inferred from other historical materials of the same period that, other than those, kokubunji in ten and several provinces were subtemples of Saidai-ji Temple.

sen.j: （なお、現存の国分寺のうち、西大寺と関係を持つのは旧伊予国分寺のみであるが、他にも複数の国分寺が真言宗各派に属している）。
sen.e: (Among kokubunji existing today, only kokubunji in former Iyo Province has relation with Saidai-ji Temple and, other than it, multiple okubunji belong to various schools of Shingon sect.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (Among kokubunji existing today, only kokubunji in former Iyo Province has relation with Saidai-ji Temple, and other than it, multiple kokubunji belong to various schools of Shingon sect.)
sen.cmt: okubunji→kokubunjiに修正、全角スペース→半角に修正、カンマの位置を移動
sen.e: (Among kokubunji existing today, only kokubunji in former Iyo Province has relation with Saidai-ji Temple, and other than it, multiple kokubunji belong to various schools of Shingon sect.)

sen.j: 西大寺は室町時代の文亀2年（1502年）の火災で大きな被害を受け、現在の伽藍はすべて江戸時代以降の再建である。
sen.e: Saidai-ji Temple suffered a serious damage in Muromachi Period in 1502 and all of buildings existing today were rebuilt in Edo Period and later.
Saidai-ji Temple suffered a serious damage in the Muromachi period in 1502 and all of buildings existing today were rebuilt in the Edo period and later.
sen.cmt: in the Muromachi period、in the Edo periodとしました。
sen.e: Saidai-ji Temple suffered a serious damage in the Muromachi period in 1502 and all of buildings existing today were rebuilt in the Edo period and later.

sen.j: なお、西大寺は1895年（明治28年）に真言宗から独立し、真言律宗を名乗っている。
sen.e: Saidai-ji Temple left Shingon sect and says that it belongs to Shingon Risshu sect.
Saidai-ji Temple left Shingon sect and says that it belongs to Shingon Risshu sect.
Saidai-ji Temple left Shingon sect and says that it belongs to Shingon Risshu sect.

sen.j: 真言律宗に属する寺院は、大本山宝山寺（奈良県生駒市）のほか、京都・浄瑠璃寺、奈良・海龍王寺、奈良・不退寺、鎌倉・極楽寺 (鎌倉市)、横浜市・称名寺 (横浜市)などがある。
sen.e: In addition to Hozan-ji Temple (Ikoma City, Nara Prefecture), the grand head temple of the sect, Joruri-ji Temple in Kyoto, Kairyuo-ji Temple in Nara, Futai-ji Temple in Nara, Gokuraku-ji Temple in Kamakura (Kamakura City), Shomyo-ji Temple in Yokohama (Yokohama City) and so on belong to Shingon Risshu sect.

In addition to Hozan-ji Temple (Ikoma City, Nara Prefecture), the grand head temple of the sect, Joruri-ji Temple in Kyoto, Kairyuo-ji Temple in Nara, Futai-ji Temple in Nara, Gokuraku-ji Temple in Kamakura City, Shomyo-ji Temple in Yokohama City and so on belong to Shingon Risshu sect.
sen.cmt: 表記重複のため、Kamakura (Kamakura City)→Kamakura City、Yokohama (Yokohama City)→Yokohama Cityとしました。
sen.e: In addition to Hozan-ji Temple (Ikoma City, Nara Prefecture), the grand head temple of the sect, Joruri-ji Temple in Kyoto, Kairyuo-ji Temple in Nara, Futai-ji Temple in Nara, Gokuraku-ji Temple in Kamakura City, Shomyo-ji Temple in Yokohama City and so on belong to Shingon Risshu sect.

sen.j: 境内には本堂、愛染堂、四王堂、聚宝館（宝物館）などが建つ。
sen.e: There are hondo (main hall), Aizendo (hall for Aizen Myoo (Ragaraja)), Shitendo, Shuhokan (treasure house) and so on in the precinct.
There are hondo (main hall), Aizendo (hall for Aizen Myoo [Ragaraja]), Shitendo, Shuhokan (treasure house) and so on in the precincts.
sen.cmt: カッコ表記・スペース修正、precinct→precinctsとしました。
sen.e: There are hondo (main hall), Aizendo (hall for Aizen Myoo [Ragaraja]), Shitendo, Shuhokan (treasure house) and so on in the precincts.

sen.j: 本堂前には東塔跡の礎石が残る。
sen.e: Foundation stones of the ruin of toto (literally, eastern pagoda) still remain in front of hondo.
Foundation stones of the ruins of toto (literally, eastern pagoda) still remain in front of hondo.
Foundation stones of the ruins of toto (literally, eastern pagoda) still remain in front of hondo.

sen.j: 本堂（重文）－
sen.e: Hondo (important cultural property)
Hondo (important cultural property)
Hondo (important cultural property)

sen.j: 寄棟造、本瓦葺。
sen.e: The building is of yosemune-zukuri (a square or rectangular building, covered with a hipped roof) and hongawarabuki (a style of tile roofing in which round and square tiles are laid down alternately).

The building is of yosemune-zukuri (a square or rectangular building, covered with a hipped roof) and hongawarabuki (a style of tile roofing in which round and square tiles are laid down alternately).

The building is of yosemune-zukuri (a square or rectangular building, covered with a hipped roof) and hongawarabuki (a style of tile roofing in which round and square tiles are laid down alternately).

sen.j: 室町時代の焼失後に再建された堂が傷んだため、修理ではなく新築することとし、寛政10年（1798年）頃造営に着手、文化 (元号)5年（1808年）頃完成したものである。
sen.e: Because the hall rebuilt after destruction by fire in Muromachi Period was damaged, it was decided not to repair but to rebuild and construction work was commenced in 1798 and it was completed around 1808.

Because the hall rebuilt after destruction by fire in the Muromachi period was damaged, it was decided not to repair but to rebuild and construction work was commenced in 1798 and it was completed around 1808.
sen.cmt: in the Muromachi periodとしました。
sen.e: Because the hall rebuilt after destruction by fire in the Muromachi period was damaged, it was decided not to repair but to rebuild and construction work was commenced in 1798 and it was completed around 1808.

sen.j: 土壁を一切用いず、装飾性の少ない伝統的な様式になる。
sen.e: No tsuchikabe (an earthened wall, or a mud wall) was used and traditional style with little decoration was adopted.
No tsuchikabe (an earthened wall, or a mud wall) was used and traditional style with little decoration was adopted.
No tsuchikabe (an earthened wall, or a mud wall) was used and traditional style with little decoration was adopted.

sen.j: 江戸時代後期の大規模仏堂建築の代表作として、1998年重要文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: It was designated as an important cultural property as a representative large-scale Buddhist temple in the late Edo Period.
It was designated an important cultural property as a representative large-scale Buddhist temple in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: Periodの頭文字を小文字に修正、designated as→designatedとしました。
sen.e: It was designated an important cultural property as a representative large-scale Buddhist temple in the late Edo period.

sen.j: この堂はかつては宝暦2年（1752年）の建築とされていたが、正しくは前述のように19世紀初頭の建築である。
sen.e: It was told once that this hall is built in 1752, but, as described above, it was built in the beginning of the nineteenth century.
It was once told that this hall was built in 1752, but, as described above, it was built in the beginning of the nineteenth century.
sen.cmt: It was told once→It was once told、this hall is→this hall wasとしました。
sen.e: It was once told that this hall was built in 1752, but, as described above, it was built in the beginning of the nineteenth century.

sen.j: 釈迦如来立像（重文）
sen.e: Shakanyorai ryuzo (standing statue of Shakanyorai (Shakyamuni)) (important cultural property)
Standing statue of Shakanyorai (Shakyamuni) (important cultural property)
Standing statue of Shakanyorai (Shakyamuni) (important cultural property)

sen.j: 西大寺の本尊。
sen.e: It is honzon Saidai-ji Temple.
It is honzon of Saidai-ji Temple.
It is honzon of Saidai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 建長元年（1249年）、仏師善慶の作。
sen.e: It was made in 1249 by Zenkei, a busshi (sculptor of Buddhist statues)..
It was made in 1249 by Zenkei, a busshi (sculptor of Buddhist statues).
It was made in 1249 by Zenkei, a busshi (sculptor of Buddhist statues).

sen.j: いわゆる「清凉寺式釈迦如来像」の典型作で、京都・清凉寺にある三国伝来の釈迦像（「三国」はインド、中国、日本を指す）の模刻である。
sen.e: It is a representative work of so-called "statues of Shakanyorai in Seiryoji style" and an imitation of sangokudenrai (literally, transmitted in three countries; "sangoku" means India, China and Japan.) statue of Shakyamuni in Seiryo-ji Temple in Kyoto.

It is a representative work of so-called 'statues of Shakanyorai in Seiryoji style' and an imitation of sangokudenrai (literally, transmitted in three countries; 'sangoku' means India, China and Japan) statue of Shakyamuni in Seiryo-ji Temple in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、文中のピリオド削除
sen.e: It is a representative work of so-called 'statues of Shakanyorai in Seiryoji style' and an imitation of sangokudenrai (literally, transmitted in three countries; 'sangoku' means India, China and Japan) statue of Shakyamuni in Seiryo-ji Temple in Kyoto.

sen.j: 像内には多数の納入品が納められていた。
sen.e: Many nonyuhin (goods stored inside the statue) were contained in the statue.
Many nonyuhin (goods stored inside the statue) were contained in the statue.
Many nonyuhin (goods stored inside the statue) were contained in the statue.

sen.j: 西大寺の鎌倉復興期の仏像は、本像の作者善慶をはじめ、名前に「善」字を用いる善派と呼ばれる一派の作が多い。
sen.e: Many of Buddhist statues of the age of restoration of Saidai-ji Temple in Kamakura Period were made by the school called Zen-ha which used a character "善 (zen)" in their names including Zenkei ("善慶") of this statue.

Many of Buddhist statues of the age of restoration of Saidai-ji Temple in the Kamakura period were made by the school called Zen-ha which used a character "善 (zen)" in their names including Zenkei ("善慶") of this statue.
sen.cmt: in the Kamakura periodとしました。
sen.e: Many of Buddhist statues of the age of restoration of Saidai-ji Temple in the Kamakura period were made by the school called Zen-ha which used a character "善 (zen)" in their names including Zenkei ("善慶") of this statue.

sen.j: 文殊菩薩及び脇侍像5体（重文）

sen.j: - 正安4年（1302年）の作。

sen.j: 像内には多数の納入品が納められていた。
sen.e: Many nonyuhin were contained in the statue.

sen.j: 四王堂－江戸時代、延宝2年（1674年）の再建。
sen.e: Shitendo - It was rebuilt in Edo Period in 1674.
Shitendo - It was rebuilt in the Edo period in 1674.
sen.cmt: in the Edo periodとしました。
sen.e: Shitendo - It was rebuilt in the Edo period in 1674.

sen.e: Standing statue of Juichimen Kannon (important cultural property)

sen.j: －平安時代後期の作。

sen.j: 四天王立像（重文）
sen.e: Standing statues of Shitenno (important cultural property)
Standing statues of Shitenno (important cultural property)
Standing statues of Shitenno (important cultural property)

sen.j: もともとは称徳天皇発願の四天王像だが,現在は足下の邪鬼にのみ奈良時代のものを残す。
sen.e: Originally, they are statues of Shitenno it was made at the wish of the Emperor Shotoku, but today, only jaki under the foot is left from Nara Period.
Originally, they are statues of Shitenno it was made at the wish of the Empress Shotoku, but today, only jaki under the foot is left from the Nara period.
sen.cmt: Empress Shotoku、the Nara periodとしました。
sen.e: Originally, they are statues of Shitenno it was made at the wish of the Empress Shotoku, but today, only jaki under the foot is left from the Nara period.

sen.j: 愛染堂
sen.e: Aizendo
Aizendo
Aizendo

sen.j: 京都御所の近衛公政所御殿を宝暦12年（1762年）移築したもの（移築年次は明和4年＝1767年とも）。
sen.e: It was Konoe-ko Mandokoro Goten in Kyoto Imperial Palace and relocated in 1762 (or 1767 by another view).

sen.j: - 宝治2年（1247年）、仏師善円作。
sen.e: It was made by Zenen, a busshi, in 1247.
It was made by Zenen, a busshi, in 1247.

sen.j: 小像ながら、日本の愛染明王像の代表作の1つ。
sen.e: Although it is small in size, it is a representative work of statues of Aizenmyoo in Japan.
Although it is small in size, it is a representative work of statues of Aizenmyoo in Japan.

sen.j: 当初の彩色や切金文様がよく残る。
sen.e: Original colors and kiriganemonyo (delicately made metal foil craft works) have been preserved in good condition.
Original colors and kiriganemonyo (delicately made metal foil craft works) have been preserved in good condition.
Original colors and kiriganemonyo (delicately made metal foil craft works) have been preserved in good condition.

sen.j: 秘仏で、毎年10月－11月頃に開扉される。
sen.e: It is treated as hibutsu (a hidden Buddhist statue) and opened for public around October to November, every year.
It is treated as hibutsu (a hidden Buddhist statue) and opened for public around October to November, every year.
It is treated as hibutsu (a hidden Buddhist statue) and opened for public around October to November, every year.

sen.j: 作者の善円は、西大寺本堂本尊・釈迦如来像の作者である善慶と同人と推定されている。
sen.e: It has been inferred that the sculptor, Zenen was the same person as Zenkei, who was the sculptor of the statue of Shakanyorai which is honzon of hondo of Saidai-ji Temple.
It has been inferred that the sculptor, Zenen was the same person as Zenkei, who was the sculptor of the statue of Shakanyorai which is honzon of hondo of Saidai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 像内には、小像にもかかわらず、多数の納入品が納められていた。
sen.e: Although it is a small statue, many nonyuhin (goods stored inside the statue) were contained in the statue.

sen.j: 興正菩薩坐像
sen.e: Seated statue of Koshobosatsu

Seated statue of Koshobosatsu

sen.j: 堂内向かって左の間に安置される,西大寺中興の祖・叡尊の肖像彫刻。
sen.e: It is an image sculpture of Eison, who was the restorer of Saidai-ji Temple, enshrined in a room on the observer's left.
It is an image sculpture of Eison, who was the restorer of Saidai-ji Temple, enshrined in a room on the observer's left.
It is an image sculpture of Eison, who was the restorer of Saidai-ji Temple, enshrined in a room on the observer's left.

sen.j: 弘安3年（1280年）、叡尊80歳の時の肖像で、作者は仏師善春である。
sen.e: It is a shozo of Eison in 1280 when he was eighty years old and the sculptor is Zenshun, Busshi.
It is an image of Eison in 1280 when he was eighty years old and the sculptor was Zenshun, Busshi.
sen.cmt: the sculptor is→the schulptor was、a shozo→an imageとしました。
sen.e: It is an image of Eison in 1280 when he was eighty years old and the sculptor was Zenshun, Busshi.

sen.j: 長い眉毛、団子鼻の風貌は像主の面影を伝えるものと思われる。
sen.e: His appearance with long eyebrow and bulbous nose seems to carry down the relic of the model of the sculpture.
His appearance with long eyebrow and bulbous nose seems to carry down the relic of the model of the sculpture.
His appearance with long eyebrow and bulbous nose seems to carry down the relic of the model of the sculpture.

sen.j: 西大寺の鎌倉再興期の仏像には像内には多数の納入品が納められているのが特色である。
sen.e: It is a feature of Buddhist statues of the age of restoration of Saidai-ji Temple in Kamakura that many nonyuhin were contained in the statue.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is a feature of Buddhist statues of the age of restoration of Saidai-ji Temple in Kamakura that many nonyuhin were contained in the statue.

sen.j: 中でもこの像には叡尊の父母の遺骨をはじめとするおびただしい資料が納入されていた。
sen.e: In particular, tremandous volume of materials including remains of parents of Eison were contained in this statue.

sen.j: 釈迦如来、阿弥陀如来、阿閦如来、宝生如来の4体で木心乾漆造である。
sen.e: They are Shakanyorai, Amidanyorai (Amitabha Tathagata), Ashukunyorai and Hoshonyorai (Ratnasambhava, one of the Five Wisdom Buddhas) and they are made with mokushin kanshitsu-zukuri (wood-core dry lacquer).

They are Shakanyorai, Amidanyorai (Amitabha Tathagata), Ashukunyorai and Hoshonyorai (Ratnasambhava, one of the Five Wisdom Buddhas) and they are made with mokushin kanshitsu-zukuri (wood-core dry lacquer).

They are Shakanyorai, Amidanyorai (Amitabha Tathagata), Ashukunyorai and Hoshonyorai (Ratnasambhava, one of the Five Wisdom Buddhas) and they are made with mokushin kanshitsu-zukuri (wood-core dry lacquer).

sen.j: 今は失われた五重塔の初層に安置されていたと思われるもので、奈良時代末期の作。
sen.e: They are believed to have been enshrined in the first story of the lost five-storied pagoda and they were made in the late Nara Period.
They are believed to have been enshrined in the first story of the lost five-story pagoda and they were made in the late Nara period.
sen.cmt: five-story pagodaとし、Periodの頭文字を小文字に変更
sen.e: They are believed to have been enshrined in the first story of the lost five-story pagoda and they were made in the late Nara period.

sen.j: 4体のうち2体は東京と奈良の国立博物館に寄託されている。
sen.e: Two out of four have been deposited to Tokyo National Museum and Nara National Museum.
Two out of four have been deposited to Tokyo National Museum and Nara National Museum.
Two out of four have been deposited to Tokyo National Museum and Nara National Museum.

sen.j: 境内が国の史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: The precinct is designated as a national historical site.
The precincts of the temple are designated a national historical site.
sen.cmt: The precinct is→The precincts of the temple are、designated as→designatedとしました。
sen.e: The precincts of the temple are designated a national historical site.

sen.e: Color paintings on silk of 12 devas

sen.j: －12幅が完存する。
sen.e: Complete set of 12 still exist.
Complete set of 12 still exist.
Complete set of 12 still exist.

sen.j: 全体に絵具の剥落・退色が目立つが、現存遺品の少ない平安時代前期、9世紀の仏教絵画の大作として貴重。
sen.e: In whole, peeling off and fading of pigment is noticeable, but they are very precious as big pieces of Buddhist painting in the early Heian Period, ninth century, for which the number of existing relics is small.

In whole, peeling off and fading of pigment is noticeable, but they are very precious as big pieces of Buddhist painting in the early Heian period, ninth century, for which the number of existing relics is small.

sen.e: In whole, peeling off and fading of pigment is noticeable, but they are very precious as big pieces of Buddhist painting in the early Heian period, ninth century, for which the number of existing relics is small.

sen.j: 奈良国立博物館に6幅、東京と京都の国立博物館に3幅ずつ寄託されている。
sen.e: Six of them have been deposited to Nara National Museum and three each to Tokyo National Mmuseum and Kyoto National Museum.
Six of them have been deposited to Nara National Museum and three each to Tokyo National Museum and Kyoto National Museum.

sen.j: 高さ37センチの小品ながら,各所に繊細な透彫を施した入念な作で,鎌倉時代の金属工芸を代表するものの1つである。
sen.e: Although it is a small article only 37 cm high, it is provided with elaborately made sukashibo in many places and it is one of representative work of smithing in Kamakura Period.
Although it is a small article only 37 cm high, it is provided with elaborately made sukashi-bori in many places and it is one of the representative works of smithing in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 本作品は高さ約90センチの金銅（銅に金メッキ）製の塔だが、木造建築の外観を忠実に模している。

sen.j: 「一、金銅宝塔、 一、金銅宝珠形舎利塔1基（下層内安置）、一、金銅筒形容器1合、一、赤地二重襷花文錦小袋1袋、一、水晶五輪塔赤地錦小袋共1基、一、水晶五輪塔織物縫合小裹共1基（以上上層内安置）」
sen.e: 1. Gilt copper hoto, 1. Gilt copper hoju (precius orb)-shaped stupa (enshrined in the lower deck), 1. Gilt copper cylindrical container, 1. Small bag made with nishiki (brocade) with double tasuki hanamon patterns on red background, 1. Crystal gorinto (a gravestone composed of five pieces piled up one upon another) with a small bag made with red nishiki (enshrined in the upper deck).

sen.e: Ochamori
Ochamori

sen.j: －毎年1・4・10月に行われる。
sen.e: It is carried out in January, April and October, every year.
It is carried out in January, April and October, every year.

sen.j: 直径30センチ以上、重さ6～7キロの大茶碗と長さ35センチの茶筅でお茶を立て、参拝客にふるまわれる。
sen.e: Tea is whipped using a huge tea bowl using a diameter over 30 cm and weight of 6 to 7 kg and a 35 cm long tea stirrer and served to worshippers.
Tea is whipped using a huge tea bowl using a diameter over 30 cm and weight of 6 to 7 kg and a 35 cm long tea stirrer and served to worshippers.

sen.j: 叡尊が西大寺の鎮守八幡宮に茶を奉納し、お下がりの茶を参詣人にふるまったのが起源とされる。
sen.e: As legend goes, the origin of this event is that Eison dedicated tea to Chinju-Hachimangu Shrine of Saidai-ji Temple and entertained visitors with tea that had been offered.
As legend goes, the origin of this event is that Eison dedicated tea to Chinju-Hachimangu Shrine of Saidai-ji Temple and entertained visitors with tea that had been offered.
